summary: The video discusses an experiment conducted by Jamie and Adam to test the claim that running in the rain gets you wetter than walking. The experiment aims to determine whether running reduces the time spent in the rain but increases the area exposed to rain, leading to more water absorption. To ensure accurate results, they use tight-fitting clothes and add dyes to the water to make it easier to measure the absorbed water. The experiment is conducted under both windy and windless conditions, with each trial lasting a set number of hours. The results show that running indeed causes more water absorption compared to walking, confirming the initial claim.
